title: A duck has three eyelids.
An average human scalp has 100,000 hairs.

In England during Queen Victoria's reign, it was illegal to be a homosexual but not a lesbian. The reason being that when the Queen was approving the law she wouldn't believe that women would do that.
The US has more personal computers than the next 7 countries combined.
Koalas never drink water. They get fluids from the eucalyptus leaves they eat.
About 200,000,000 M&Ms are sold each day in the United States.
It is illegal to hunt camels in the state of Arizona.
A snail takes 33 hours to crawl one mile.
Clouds fly higher during the day than the night.
It was once against the law to slam your car door in a city in Switzerland.
Arachibutyrophobia is the fear of peanut butter sticking to the roof of your mouth.
A hamlet is a village without a church and a town is not a city until it has a cathedral.
Your skull is made up of 29 different bones.
What is called a 'French kiss' in the English speaking world is known as an 'English kiss' in France.
All gondolas in Venice, Italy must be painted black, unless they belong to a high official.
Tigers have striped skin, not just striped fur.
The official beverage of Ohio is tomato juice.
Andorra, a tiny country between France & Spain, has the longest average lifespan: 83.49 years.
You can lead a cow upstairs but not downstairs.
The average garden variety caterpillar has 248 muscles in its head.
In Raiders of the Lost Ark there is a wall carving of R2-D2 and C-3P0 behind the ark
By raising your legs slowly and lying on your back, you cannot sink into quicksand.
Ernest Vincent Wright wrote a 50,000 word novel Gatsby without any word containing 'e.'
There are 45 miles of nerves in the skin of a human being.
Insects outnumber humans 100,000,000 to one.
Bulls are colorblind and will usually charge at a cape regardless of colour.
In England, the Speaker of the House is not allowed to speak.
A full loaded supertanker traveling at normal speed takes at least twenty minutes to stop.
It takes the stomach an hour to break down cowsâ€™ milk.
If you go blind in one eye you only lose about one fifth of your vision but all your sense of depth.
In 1825, Upper Peru became Bolivia.
Jim Morrison, of the 60's rock group The Doors, was the first rock star to be arrested on stage.
Clinophobia is the fear of beds.
If you bring a raccoon's head to the Henniker, New Hampshire town hall, you are entitled to receive $.10 from the town.
The Hawaiian alphabet has only 12 letters.
It takes 8.5 minutes for light to get from the sun to earth.
Barbie's full name is 'Babara Millicent Roberts.'
Fingernails grow nearly 4 times faster than toenails!
It's illegal to spit on the sidewalk in Norfolk, Virginia.
The Brimstone butterfly (Gonepterix rhamni) has the longest lifetime of the adult butterflies: 9-10 months.
Bob Dylan's real name is Robert Zimmerman.
Humans use a total of 72 different muscles in speech.
The strongest muscle in the human body is the tongue. (the heart is not a muscle)
Table tennis balls have been known to travel off the paddle at speeds up to 160 km/hr.
You are more likely to be killed by a champagne cork than by a poisonous spider.
In the 17th century, the value of pi was known to 35 decimal places. Today, to 1.2411 trillion.
Corduroy comes from the French, cord du roi or cloth of the king.
A shark is the only fish that can blink with both eyes.
Greenland is the largest island in the world.
More than 90% of the Nicaraguan people are Roman Catholic.
In the great fire of London in 1666 half of London was burnt down but only 6 people were injured.
At the nearest point, Russia and America are less than 4 km apart.
The first bomb the Allies dropped on Berlin in WWII killed the only elephant in the Berlin Zoo.
In Papua New Guinea, there are villages within five miles of each other which speak different languages.
Chameleons can move their eyes in two directions at the same time.
The state of Florida is bigger than England.
The toothbrush was invented in China in 1498.
While in Alcatraz, Al Capone was inmate 85.
A creep is a metallurgical term for when something that is normally very strong bends because of gravity. This happens to many metals at high temperatures, where they won't melt but they will creep.
The original story from 'Tales of 1001 Arabian Nights' begins, 'Aladdin was a little Chinese boy.'
The first CD pressed in the US was Bruce Springsteenâ€™s 'Born in the USA'.
Almost is the longest word in the English language with all the letters in alphabetical order.
Abraham Lincolnâ€™s ghost is said to haunt the White House.
It can take as long as 4 hours to hard-boil an ostrich egg.
A dragonfly has a lifespan of 24 hours.
Honey is the only food that does not spoil.
Canada is the only country not to win a gold medal in the summer Olympic games while hosting.
Certain frogs can be frozen solid then thawed, and continue living.
A group of owls is called a parliament.
During it's lifetime an oyster changes its sex from male to female and back several times.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds
Apart from humans, certain species of chimpanzee are the only animals to experiment sexually. They have been known to 'wife swap' and indulge in group sex.
In Washington D.C., no building can be built taller than the Capitol.
The 'pound' key on your keyboard () is called an octotroph.
In the U.S, Frisbees outsell footballs, baseballs and basketballs combined.
Karoke means empty orchestra in Japanese.
The penguin is the only bird that can swim but can't fly.
Methane gas can often be seen bubbling up from the bottom of ponds. It is produced by the decomposition of dead plants and animals in the mud.
In England, in the 1880's pants was considered a dirty word.
At any given time, there are 1,800 thunderstorms in progress over the earth's atmosphere.
Chinese Crested dogs can get acne.
Alma mater means bountiful mother.
A polar bears skin is black. Its fur is actually clear, but like snow it appears white.
Astronaut Neil Armstrong first stepped on the moon with his left foot.
Most lipstick contains fish scales.
Termites outweigh humans by almost ten to one.
Dibble means to drink like a duck.
More people are allergic to cow's milk than any other food.
Americans are responsible for about 1/5 of the worldâ€™s garbage annually.
There are over a million described species of insects. Some people estimate there are actually between 15 and 30 million species.
A camel's backbone is just as straight as a horse's.
Hawaiian words do not contain consonant clusters. For example, Kahlua is not a hawaiian word.

The expression getting someone's goat is based on the custom of keeping a goat in the stable with a racehorse as the horse's companion. The goat becomes a settling influence on the thoroughbred. If you owned a competing horse and were not above some dirty business, you could steal your rival's goat (seriously, it's been done) to upset the other horse and make it run a poor race. From goats and horses it was linguistically extended to people: in order to upset someone, get their goat. (Source: A BROWSER'S DICTIONARY)
A cubic mile of fog is made up of less than a gallon of water.
A square mile of fertile earth has 32,000,000 earthworms in it.
In York, it is perfectly legal to shoot a Scotsman with a bow and arrow (except on Sundays)
Starfish have no brains.
Research indicates that mosquitos are attracted to people who have recently eaten bananas.
A group of crows is called a murder.
Lizards can self-amputate their tails for protection. It grows back after a few months.
